method.name: addCompany

param.comment: the max number of company users (optionally 0)

throws.name: PortalException

method.name: checkCompany
method.comment:
Returns the company with the web domain.
The method sets mail domain to the web domain, and the shard name to the default name set in portal.properties

param.name: webId
param.comment: the company's web domain

return.comment: the company with the web domain

method.name: checkCompany
method.comment:
Returns the company with the web domain, mail domain, and shard. If no such company exits, the method will create a new company.
The method goes through a series of checks to ensure that the company contains default users, groups, etc.

param.name: webId
param.comment: the company's web domain

param.name: mx
param.comment: the company's mail domain

param.name: shardName
param.comment: the company's shard

return.comment: the company with the web domain, mail domain, and shard

method.comment:

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all assets that match the keywords in the company.
The method is called in {@link com.liferay.portal.search.PortalOpenSearchImpl} which is not longer used by the Search portlet.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the company

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user

param.name: keywords
param.comment: the keywords (space separated),which may occur in assets in the company (optionally null)

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of assets to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of assets to return (not inclusive)

return.comment: the matching assets in the company

method.name: search
method.comment: Returns an ordered range of all assets that match the keywords in the portlet within the company.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the company

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user

param.name: portletId
param.comment: the primary key of the portlet (optionally null)

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group (optionally 0)

param.name: type
param.comment: the mime type of assets to return(optionally null)

param.name: keywords
param.comment: the keywords (space separated), which may occur in any assets in the portlet (optionally null)

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of assets to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of assets to return (not inclusive)

return.comment: the matching assets in the portlet within the company

javadoc.name: GroupLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
The group local service is responsible for accessing, creating, modifying and deleting groups.

Groups are mostly used in Liferay as a resource container for permissioning and content scoping purposes as described in {@link com.liferay.portal.model.impl.GroupImpl}.

Groups are also the entity to which LayoutSets are generally associated. Since LayoutSets are the parent entities of Layouts (i.e. pages), no entity can have associated pages without also having an associated Group. This relationship can be depicted as ... Layout -> LayoutSet -> Group[type] [-> Entity]. Note, the Entity part is optional.

Group has a "type" definition that is typically identified by two fields of the entity - String className, and int type .

The className field helps create the group's association with other entities (e.g. Organization, User, Company, UserGroup, ... etc.). The value of className is the full name of the entity's class and the primary key of the associated entity instance. A site has className="Group" and has no associated entity.

The type field helps distinguish between a group used strictly for scoping and a group that also has pages (in which case the type is SITE). For a list of types, see {@link com.liferay.portal.model.GroupConstants}.

Here is a listing of how Group is related to some portal entities ...

  • Site is a Group with className="Group"
  • Company has 1 Group (this is the global scope, but never has pages)
  • User has 1 Group (pages are optional based on the behavior configuration for personal pages)
  • Layout Template (LayoutPrototype) has 1 Group which uses only 1 of it's 2 LayoutSets to store a single page which can later be used to derive a single page in any Site
  • Site Template (LayoutSetPrototype) has 1 Group which uses only 1 of it's 2 LayoutSets to store many pages which can later be used to derive entire Sites or pulled into an existing Site
  • Organization has 1 Group, but can also be associated to a Site at any point in it's life cycle in order to support having pages
  • UserGroup has 1 Group that can have pages in both of the group's LayoutSets which are later inherited by users assigned to the UserGroup
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan
Alexander Chow
Bruno Farache
Wesley Gong

method.name: deleteGroup
method.comment:
Deletes the group and its associated data.

The group is unstaged and its assets and resources including layouts, membership requests, subscriptions, teams, blogs, bookmarks, calendar events, image gallery, journals, message boards, polls, shopping related entities, software catalog, and wikis are also deleted.

param.name: group
param.comment: the group

return.comment: the deleted group

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the group was a system group, or if the user did not have permission to delete the group or its assets or its resources

method.name: deleteGroup
method.comment:
Deletes the group and its associated data.

The group is unstaged and its assets and resources including layouts, membership requests, subscriptions, teams, blogs, bookmarks, calendar events, image gallery, journals, message boards, polls, shopping related entities, software catalog, and wikis are also deleted.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

return.comment: the deleted group

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if a group with the primary key could not be found, if the group was a system group, or if the user did not have permission to delete the group, its assets, or its resources

Returns an ordered range of all the groups that match the class name IDs and keywords, optionally including the user's inherited organization groups and user groups. System and staged groups are not included.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the company

param.name: classNameIds
param.comment: the group's class name IDs (optionally null)

param.name: keywords
param.comment: the keywords (space separated), which may occur in the sites's name, or description (optionally null)

param.name: params
param.comment: the finder params (optionally null). To include a user's organizations, inherited organizations, and user groups in the search, add an entry with key "usersGroups" mapped to the user's ID and an entry with key "inherit" mapped to a non-null object. For more information see {@link com.liferay.portal.service.persistence.GroupFinder}

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of groups to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of groups to return (not inclusive)

param.name: obc
param.comment: the comparator to order the groups (optionally null)

return.comment: the matching groups ordered by comparator obc

param.name: params

To include a user's organizations, inherited organizations, and user groups in the search, add an entry with key "usersGroups" mapped to the user's ID and an entry with key "inherit" mapped to a non-null object. For more information see {@link com.liferay.portal.service.persistence.GroupFinder}

param.name: andOperator
param.comment: whether every field must match its keywords, or just one field.

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of groups to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of groups to return (not inclusive)

return.comment: the matching groups ordered by name

method.comment: Adds a group.

method.name: deleteGroup
method.comment:
Deletes the group.

The group is unstaged and its assets and resources including layouts, membership requests, subscriptions, teams, blogs, bookmarks, calendar events, image gallery, journals, message boards, polls, shopping related entities, software catalog, and wikis are also deleted.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the user did not have permission to delete the group or its assets or resources, if a group with the primary key could not be found, or if the group was a system group

method.name: getUserOrganizationsGroups
method.comment:
Returns the range of all groups associated with the user's organization groups, including the ancestors of the organization groups, unless portal property organizations.membership.strict is set to true.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of groups to consider

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of groups to consider (not inclusive)

return.comment: the range of groups associated with the user's organizations

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if a user with the primary key could not be found or if another portal exception occurred

method.name: getUserPlaces
method.comment:
Returns the user's group "places" associated with the group entity class names, including the control panel group if the user is permitted to view the control panel.

  • Class name "User" includes the user's layout set group.
  • Class name "Organization" includes the user's immediate organization groups and inherited organization groups.
  • Class name "Group" includes the user's immediate organization groups and site groups.
  • A classNames value of null includes the user's layout set group, organization groups, inherited organization groups, and site groups.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user

param.name: classNames
param.comment: the group entity class names (optionally null). For more information see {@link #getUserPlaces(long, String[], int)}

param.name: max
param.comment: the maximum number of groups to return

return.comment: the user's group "places"

method.name: getUserPlaces
method.comment:
Returns the guest or current user's group "places" associated with the group entity class names, including the control panel group if the user is permitted to view the control panel.

  • Class name "User" includes the user's layout set group.
  • Class name "Organization" includes the user's immediate organization groups and inherited organization groups.
  • Class name "Group" includes the user's immediate organization groups and site groups.
  • A classNames value of null includes the user's layout set group, organization groups, inherited organization groups, and site groups.

param.name: classNames
param.comment: the group entity class names (optionally null). For more information see {@link #getUserPlaces(String[], int)}

param.name: max
param.comment: the maximum number of groups to return

return.comment: the user's group "places"

method.name: getUserPlacesCount
method.comment: Returns the number of the guest or current user's group "places" associated with the group entity class names, including the control panel group if the user is permitted to view the control panel.

return.comment: the number of user's group "places"

method.name: getUserSites
method.comment: Returns the guest or current user's layout set group, organization groups, inherited organization groups, and site groups.

return.comment: the user's layout set group, organization groups, and inherited organization groups, and site groups

method.name: hasUserGroup
method.comment: Returns true if the user is associated with the group, including the user's inherited organizations and user groups. System and staged groups are not included.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

return.comment: true if the user is associated with the group; false otherwise

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the current user did not have permission to view the user or group members

method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the site groups and organization groups that match the name and description, optionally including the user's inherited organization groups and user groups. System and staged groups are not included.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the company

param.name: name
param.comment: the group's name (optionally null)

param.name: description
param.comment: the group's description (optionally null)

param.name: params
param.comment: the finder params (optionally null). To include the user's inherited organizations and user groups in the search, add entries having "usersGroups" and "inherit" as keys mapped to the the user's ID. For more information see {@link com.liferay.portal.service.persistence.GroupFinder}

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of groups to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of groups to return (not inclusive)

return.comment: the matching groups ordered by name

method.name: searchCount

param.name: description

param.name: params
param.comment: the finder params (optionally null). To include the user's inherited organizations and user groups in the search, add entries having "usersGroups" and "inherit" as keys mapped to the the user's ID. For more information see {@link com.liferay.portal.service.persistence.GroupFinder}

return.comment: the number of matching groups

param.comment: whether layout is private to the group

method.name: addLayout
method.comment:
Adds a layout with additional parameters.

This method handles the creation of the layout including its resources, metadata, and internal data structures. It is not necessary to make subsequent calls to any methods to setup default groups, resources, ... etc.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: privateLayout
param.comment: whether the layout is private to the group

param.name: parentLayoutId
param.comment: the primary key of the parent layout (optionally {@link com.liferay.portal.model.LayoutConstants#DEFAULT_PARENT_LAYOUT_ID})

param.name: nameMap
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized names

param.name: titleMap
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized titles

param.name: descriptionMap
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized descriptions

param.name: keywordsMap
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized keywords

param.name: robotsMap
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized robots

param.name: type
param.comment: the layout's type (optionally {@link com.liferay.portal.model.LayoutConstants#TYPE_PORTLET}). The possible types can be found in {@link com.liferay.portal.model.LayoutConstants}.

param.name: hidden
param.comment: whether the layout is hidden

param.name: friendlyURL
param.comment: the layout's friendly URL (optionally {@link com.liferay.portal.util.PropsValues#DEFAULT_USER_PRIVATE_LAYOUT_FRIENDLY_URL} or {@link com.liferay.portal.util.PropsValues#DEFAULT_USER_PUBLIC_LAYOUT_FRIENDLY_URL}). The default values can be overridden in portal-ext.properties by specifying new values for the corresponding properties defined in {@link com.liferay.portal.util.PropsValues}. To see how the URL is normalized when accessed see {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.util.FriendlyURLNormalizerUtil#normalize( String)}.

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context. Must set the universally unique identifier (UUID) for the layout. Can set the creation date, modification date and the expando bridge attributes for the layout. For layouts that belong to a layout set prototype, an attribute named 'layoutUpdateable' can be set to specify whether site administrators can modify this page within their site. For layouts that are created from a layout prototype, attributes named 'layoutPrototypeUuid' and 'layoutPrototypeLinkedEnabled' can be specified to provide the unique identifier of the source prototype and a boolean to determined whether a link to it should be enabled to activate propagation of changes made to the linked page in the prototype.

return.comment: the layout

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if a group or user with the primary key could not be found, or if layout values were invalid

param.comment: the layout's new friendly URL (optionally {@link com.liferay.portal.util.PropsValues#DEFAULT_USER_PRIVATE_LAYOUT_FRIENDLY_URL} or {@link com.liferay.portal.util.PropsValues#DEFAULT_USER_PRIVATE_LAYOUT_FRIENDLY_URL}). The default values can be overridden in portal-ext.properties by specifying new values for the corresponding properties defined in {@link com.liferay.portal.util.PropsValues}. To see how the URL is normalized when accessed see {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.util.FriendlyURLNormalizerUtil#normalize( String)}.

param.name: iconImage
param.comment: whether the icon image will be updated

param.name: iconBytes
param.comment: the byte array of the layout's new icon image

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context. Can set the modification date and expando bridge attributes for the layout. For layouts that are linked to a layout prototype, attributes named 'layoutPrototypeUuid' and 'layoutPrototypeLinkedEnabled' can be specified to provide the unique identifier of the source prototype and a boolean to determined whether a link to it should be enabled to activate propagation of changes made to the linked page in the prototype.

return.comment: the updated layout

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if a group or layout with the primary key could not be found, if a unique friendly URL could not be generated, if a valid parent layout ID to use could not be found, or if the layout parameters were invalid

javadoc.name: LayoutServiceImpl
javadoc.comment: The implementation of the layout service.
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan
Wesley Gong

method.name: addLayout
method.comment:
Adds a layout with additional parameters.

This method handles the creation of the layout including its resources, metadata, and internal data structures. It is not necessary to make subsequent calls to any methods to setup default groups, resources, ... etc.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: privateLayout
param.comment: whether the layout is private to the group

param.name: parentLayoutId
param.comment: the primary key of the parent layout (optionally {@link com.liferay.portal.model.LayoutConstants#DEFAULT_PARENT_LAYOUT_ID})

param.name: localeNamesMap
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized names

param.name: localeTitlesMap
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized titles

param.name: descriptionMap
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized descriptions

param.name: keywordsMap
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized keywords

param.name: robotsMap
param.comment: the layout's locales and localized robots

param.name: type
param.comment: the layout's type (optionally {@link com.liferay.portal.model.LayoutConstants#TYPE_PORTLET}). The possible types can be found in {@link com.liferay.portal.model.LayoutConstants}.

param.name: hidden
param.comment: whether the layout is hidden

param.name: friendlyURL
param.comment: the layout's friendly URL (optionally {@link com.liferay.portal.util.PropsValues#DEFAULT_USER_PRIVATE_LAYOUT_FRIENDLY_URL} or {@link com.liferay.portal.util.PropsValues#DEFAULT_USER_PUBLIC_LAYOUT_FRIENDLY_URL}). The default values can be overridden in portal-ext.properties by specifying new values for the corresponding properties defined in {@link com.liferay.portal.util.PropsValues}. To see how the URL is normalized when accessed see {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.util.FriendlyURLNormalizerUtil#normalize( String)}.

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context. Must set the universally unique identifier (UUID) for the layout. Can set the creation date, modification date and the expando bridge attributes for the layout. For layouts that belong to a layout set prototype, an attribute named 'layoutUpdateable' can be used to specify whether site administrators can modify this page within their site.

return.comment: the layout

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if a group with the primary key could not be found, if the group did not have permission to manage the layouts involved, or if layout values were invalid

method.name: addLayout
method.comment:
Adds a layout with empty maps for descriptions, keywords, and titles , and a names map containing a mapping for the default locale as its only entry.

This method handles the creation of the layout including its resources, metadata, and internal data structures. It is not necessary to make subsequent calls to any methods to setup default groups, resources, ... etc.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: privateLayout
param.comment: whether the layout is private to the group

param.name: parentLayoutId
param.comment: the primary key of the parent layout (optionally {@link com.liferay.portal.model.LayoutConstants#DEFAULT_PARENT_LAYOUT_ID})

param.name: name
param.comment: Map the layout's locales and localized names

param.name: title
param.comment: Map the layout's locales and localized titles

param.name: description
param.comment: Map the layout's locales and localized descriptions

param.name: type
param.comment: the layout's type (optionally {@link com.liferay.portal.model.LayoutConstants#TYPE_PORTLET}). The possible types can be found in {@link com.liferay.portal.model.LayoutConstants}.

param.name: hidden
param.comment: whether the layout is hidden

param.name: friendlyURL
param.comment: the layout's friendly URL (optionally {@link com.liferay.portal.util.PropsValues#DEFAULT_USER_PRIVATE_LAYOUT_FRIENDLY_URL} or {@link com.liferay.portal.util.PropsValues#DEFAULT_USER_PUBLIC_LAYOUT_FRIENDLY_URL}). The default values can be overridden in portal-ext.properties by specifying new values for the corresponding properties defined in {@link com.liferay.portal.util.PropsValues}. To see how the URL is normalized when accessed see {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.util.FriendlyURLNormalizerUtil#normalize( String)}.

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context. Must set the universally unique identifier (UUID) for the layout. Can specify the creation date, modification date and the expando bridge attributes for the layout. For layouts that belong to a layout set prototype, an attribute named 'layoutUpdateable' can be used to specify whether site administrators can modify this page within their site.

return.comment: the layout

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if a group with the primary key could not be found, if the group did not have permission to manage the layouts involved, or if layout values were invalid

method.name: updateLayoutSetPrototypeLinkEnabled
method.comment:
Updates the state of the layout set prototype link.

This method can disable the layout set prototype's link by setting layoutSetPrototypeLinkEnabled to false. However, this method can only enable the layout set prototype's link if the layout set prototype's current uuid is not null. Setting the layoutSetPrototypeLinkEnabled to true when the layout set prototype's current uuid is null will have no effect.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: privateLayout
param.comment: whether the layout set is private to the group

param.name: layoutSetPrototypeLinkEnabled
param.comment: whether the layout set prototype is link enabled

param.comment: the uuid of the layout set prototype to link with

method.name: addOrganization
method.comment:
Adds an organization.

This method handles the creation and bookkeeping of the organization including its resources, metadata, and internal data structures. It is not necessary to make a subsequent call to {@link #addOrganizationResources(long, Organization)}.

param.name: statusId

return.comment: the organization

throws.name: PortalException

method.name: hasUserOrganization
method.comment: Returns true if the user is a member of the organization. This method is usually called to determine if the user has view access to a resource belonging to the organization.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user

param.name: organizationId
param.comment: the primary key of the organization

return.comment: true if the user has access to the organization; false otherwise

method.name: hasUserOrganization
method.comment:
Returns true if the user is a member of the organization, optionally focusing on sub-organizations or the specified organization. This method is usually called to determine if the user has view access to a resource belonging to the organization.

  1. If inheritSuborganizations=false: the method checks whether the user belongs to the organization specified by organizationId. The parameter includeSpecifiedOrganization is ignored.
  2. The parameter includeSpecifiedOrganization is ignored unless inheritSuborganizations is also true.
  3. If inheritSuborganizations=true and includeSpecifiedOrganization=false: the method checks whether the user belongs to one of the child organizations of the one specified by organizationId.
  4. If inheritSuborganizations=true and includeSpecifiedOrganization=true: the method checks whether the user belongs to the organization specified by organizationId or any of its child organizations.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the organization's user

param.name: organizationId
param.comment: the primary key of the organization

param.name: inheritSuborganizations
param.comment: if true sub-organizations are considered in the determination

param.name: includeSpecifiedOrganization
param.comment: if true the organization specified by organizationId is considered in the determination

return.comment: true if the user has access to the organization; false otherwise

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if an organization with the primary key could not be found

Rebuilds the organizations tree.

Only call this method if the tree has become stale through operations other than normal CRUD. Under normal circumstances the tree is automatically rebuilt whenever necessary.

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the organizations whose name, type, or location fields match the keywords specified for them, using the indexer. It is preferable to use this method instead of the non-indexed version whenever possible for performance reasons.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the organization's company

param.name: parentOrganizationId
param.comment: the primary key of the organization's parent organization

param.name: name
param.comment: the name keywords (space separated, optionally null)

param.name: type
param.comment: the type keywords (optionally null)

param.name: street
param.comment: the street keywords (optionally null)

param.name: city
param.comment: the city keywords (optionally null)

param.name: zip
param.comment: the zipcode keywords (optionally null)

param.name: region
param.comment: the region keywords (optionally null)

param.name: country
param.comment: the country keywords (optionally null)

param.name: params
param.comment: the finder parameters (optionally null). For more information see {@link com.liferay.portlet.usersadmin.util.OrganizationIndexer}.

param.name: andSearch
param.comment: whether every field must match its keywords or just one field

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of organizations to return

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of organizations to return (not inclusive)

param.name: sort
param.comment: the field and direction by which to sort (optionally null)

return.comment: the matching organizations ordered by sort

javadoc.name: ResourcePermissionLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
Manages the creation and upkeep of resource permissions, and provides methods for granting, revoking, and checking permissions.

Before attempting to read any of the documentation for this class, first read {@link com.liferay.portal.model.impl.ResourcePermissionImpl} for an explanation of scoping.
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan
Raymond Aug
Connor McKay

method.name: addResourcePermission
method.comment:
Grants the role permission at the scope to perform the action on resources of the type. Existing actions are retained.

This method cannot be used to grant individual scope permissions, but is only intended for adding permissions at the company, group, and group-template scopes. For example, this method could be used to grant a company scope permission to edit message board posts.

If a company scope permission is granted to resources that the role already had group scope permissions to, the group scope permissions are deleted. Likewise, if a group scope permission is granted to resources that the role already had company scope permissions to, the company scope permissions are deleted. Be aware that this latter behavior can result in an overall reduction in permissions for the role.

Depending on the scope, the value of primKey will have different meanings. For more information, see {@link com.liferay.portal.model.impl.ResourcePermissionImpl}.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the company

param.name: name
param.comment: the resource's name, which can be either a class name or a portlet ID

param.name: scope
param.comment: the scope. This method only supports company, group, and group-template scope.

param.name: primKey
param.comment: the primary key

param.name: roleId
param.comment: the primary key of the role

param.name: actionId
param.comment: the action ID

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if scope was set to individual scope or if a role with the primary key or a resource action with the name and action ID could not be found

method.name: addResourcePermissions
method.comment:
Grants the role permissions at the scope to perform the actions on all resources of the type. Existing actions are retained.

This method should only be used to add default permissions to existing resources en masse during upgrades or while verifying permissions. For example, this method could be used to grant site members individual scope permissions to view all blog posts.

param.name: resourceName
param.comment: the resource's name, which can be either a class name or a portlet ID

param.name: roleName
param.comment: the role's name

param.name: scope
param.comment: the scope

param.name: resourceActionBitwiseValue
param.comment: the bitwise IDs of the actions

method.name: deleteResourcePermissions
method.comment:
Deletes all resource permissions at the scope to resources of the type. This method should not be confused with any of the removeResourcePermission methods, as its purpose is very different. This method should only be used for deleting resource permissions that refer to a resource when that resource is deleted. For example this method could be used to delete all individual scope permissions to a blog post when it is deleted.

Depending on the scope, the value of primKey will have different meanings. For more information, see {@link com.liferay.portal.model.impl.ResourcePermissionImpl}.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the company

param.name: name
param.comment: the resource's name, which can be either a class name or a portlet ID

param.name: scope
param.comment: the scope

param.name: primKey
param.comment: the primary key

method.name: setOwnerResourcePermissions
method.comment:
Updates the role's permissions at the scope, setting the actions that can be performed on resources of the type, also setting the owner of any newly created resource permissions. Existing actions are replaced.

This method can be used to set permissions at any scope, but it is generally only used at the individual scope. For example, it could be used to set the guest permissions on a blog post.

Depending on the scope, the value of primKey will have different meanings. For more information, see {@link com.liferay.portal.model.impl.ResourcePermissionImpl}.

Depending on the scope, the value of primKey will have different meanings. For more information, see {@link com.liferay.portal.model.impl.ResourcePermissionImpl}.

javadoc.name: ResourcePermissionServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
Manages the creation and upkeep of resource permissions, and provides methods for granting, revoking, and checking permissions.

Before attempting to read any of the documentation for this class, first read {@link com.liferay.portal.model.impl.ResourcePermissionImpl} for an explanation of scoping.
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan

method.name: addResourcePermission
method.comment:
Grants the role permission at the scope to perform the action on resources of the type. Existing actions are retained.

This method cannot be used to grant individual scope permissions, but is only intended for adding permissions at the company, group, and group-template scopes. For example, this method could be used to grant a company scope permission to edit message board posts.

If a company scope permission is granted to resources that the role already had group scope permissions to, the group scope permissions are deleted. Likewise, if a group scope permission is granted to resources that the role already had company scope permissions to, the company scope permissions are deleted. Be aware that this latter behavior can result in an overall reduction in permissions for the role.

Depending on the scope, the value of primKey will have different meanings. For more information, see {@link com.liferay.portal.model.impl.ResourcePermissionImpl}.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the company

param.name: name
param.comment: the resource's name, which can be either a class name or a portlet ID

param.name: scope
param.comment: the scope. This method only supports company, group, and group-template scope.

param.name: primKey
param.comment: the primary key

param.name: roleId
param.comment: the primary key of the role

param.name: actionId
param.comment: the action ID

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the user did not have permission to add resource permissions, or if scope was set to individual scope or if a role with the primary key or a resource action with the name and action ID could not be found

The method searches the system roles map first for default roles. If a role with the name is not found, then the method will query the database.

param.comment: the primary key of the company

param.comment: the role's name

method.name: getDefaultGroupRole
method.comment:
Returns the default role for the group with the primary key.

If the group is a site, then the default role is {@link com.liferay.portal.model.RoleConstants#SITE_MEMBER}. If the group is an organization, then the default role is {@link com.liferay.portal.model.RoleConstants#ORGANIZATION_USER}. If the group is a user or user group, then the default role is {@link com.liferay.portal.model.RoleConstants#POWER_USER}. For all other group types, the default role is {@link com.liferay.portal.model.RoleConstants#USER}.

param.name: groupId
param.comment: the primary key of the group

return.comment: the default role for the group with the primary key

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if a group with the primary key could not be found, or if a default role could not be found for the group

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

method.name: addUser
method.comment:
Adds a user.

This method handles the creation and bookkeeping of the user including its resources, metadata, and internal data structures. It is not necessary to make subsequent calls to any methods to setup default groups, resources, etc.

param.name: creatorUserId
param.comment: the primary key of the creator

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the user's company

param.name: autoPassword
param.comment: whether a password should be automatically generated for the user

param.name: password1
param.comment: the user's password

param.name: password2
param.comment: the user's password confirmation

param.name: autoScreenName
param.comment: whether a screen name should be automatically generated for the user

param.name: screenName
param.comment: the user's screen name

param.name: emailAddress
param.comment: the user's email address

param.name: facebookId
param.comment: the user's facebook ID

param.name: openId
param.comment: the user's OpenID

param.name: locale
param.comment: the user's locale

param.name: firstName
param.comment: the user's first name

param.name: middleName
param.comment: the user's middle name

param.name: lastName
param.comment: the user's last name

param.name: prefixId
param.comment: the user's name prefix ID

param.name: suffixId
param.comment: the user's name suffix ID

param.name: male
param.comment: whether the user is male

param.name: birthdayMonth
param.comment: the user's birthday month (0-based, meaning 0 for January)

param.name: birthdayDay
param.comment: the user's birthday day

param.name: birthdayYear
param.comment: the user's birthday year

param.name: jobTitle
param.comment: the user's job title

param.name: groupIds
param.comment: the primary keys of the user's groups

param.name: organizationIds
param.comment: the primary keys of the user's organizations

param.name: roleIds
param.comment: the primary keys of the roles this user possesses

param.name: userGroupIds
param.comment: the primary keys of the user's user groups

param.name: sendEmail
param.comment: whether to send the user an email notification about their new account

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the user's service context (optionally null). Can set the universally unique identifier (with the uuid attribute), asset category IDs, asset tag names, and expando bridge attributes for the user.

return.comment: the new user

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the user's information was invalid

method.name: authenticateByEmailAddress
method.comment: Attempts to authenticate the user by their email address and password, while using the AuthPipeline.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the user's company

param.name: emailAddress
param.comment: the user's email address

param.name: password
param.comment: the user's password

param.name: headerMap
param.comment: the header map from the authentication request

param.name: parameterMap
param.comment: the parameter map from the authentication request

param.name: resultsMap
param.comment: the map of authentication results (may be nil). After a succesful authentication the user's primary key will be placed under the key userId.

return.comment: the authentication status. This can be {@link com.liferay.portal.security.auth.Authenticator#FAILURE} indicating that the user's credentials are invalid, {@link com.liferay.portal.security.auth.Authenticator#SUCCESS} indicating a successful login, or {@link com.liferay.portal.security.auth.Authenticator#DNE} indicating that a user with that login does not exist.

method.name: authenticateByScreenName
method.comment: Attempts to authenticate the user by their screen name and password, while using the AuthPipeline.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the user's company

param.comment: the user's screen name

param.name: password
param.comment: the user's password

param.name: headerMap
param.comment: the header map from the authentication request

param.name: parameterMap
param.comment: the parameter map from the authentication request

param.name: resultsMap
param.comment: the map of authentication results (may be nil). After a succesful authentication the user's primary key will be placed under the key userId.

return.comment: the authentication status. This can be {@link com.liferay.portal.security.auth.Authenticator#FAILURE} indicating that the user's credentials are invalid, {@link com.liferay.portal.security.auth.Authenticator#SUCCESS} indicating a successful login, or {@link com.liferay.portal.security.auth.Authenticator#DNE} indicating that a user with that login does not exist.

method.name: authenticateByUserId
method.comment: Attempts to authenticate the user by their primary key and password, while using the AuthPipeline.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the user's company

param.name: userId
param.comment: the user's primary key

param.name: password
param.comment: the user's password

param.name: headerMap
param.comment: the header map from the authentication request

param.name: parameterMap
param.comment: the parameter map from the authentication request

param.name: resultsMap
param.comment: the map of authentication results (may be nil). After a succesful authentication the user's primary key will be placed under the key userId.

return.comment: the authentication status. This can be {@link com.liferay.portal.security.auth.Authenticator#FAILURE} indicating that the user's credentials are invalid, {@link com.liferay.portal.security.auth.Authenticator#SUCCESS} indicating a successful login, or {@link com.liferay.portal.security.auth.Authenticator#DNE} indicating that a user with that login does not exist.

method.name: authenticateForBasic
method.comment:
Attempts to authenticate the user using HTTP basic access authentication, without using the AuthPipeline. Primarily used for authenticating users of tunnel-web.

Authentication type specifies what login contains.The valid values are:

  • CompanyConstants.AUTH_TYPE_EA - login is the user's email address
  • CompanyConstants.AUTH_TYPE_SN - login is the user's screen name
  • CompanyConstants.AUTH_TYPE_ID - login is the user's primary key

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the user's company

param.name: authType
param.comment: the type of authentication to perform

param.name: login
param.comment: either the user's email address, screen name, or primary key depending on the value of authType

param.name: password
param.comment: the user's password

return.comment: the authentication status. This can be {@link com.liferay.portal.security.auth.Authenticator#FAILURE} indicating that the user's credentials are invalid, {@link com.liferay.portal.security.auth.Authenticator#SUCCESS} indicating a successful login, or {@link com.liferay.portal.security.auth.Authenticator#DNE} indicating that a user with that login does not exist.

method.name: authenticateForDigest
method.comment: Attempts to authenticate the user using HTTP digest access authentication, without using the AuthPipeline. Primarily used for authenticating users of tunnel-web.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the user's company

param.name: username
param.comment: either the user's email address, screen name, or primary key

param.name: realm
param.comment: unused

param.name: nonce
param.comment: the number used once

param.name: method
param.comment: the request method

param.name: uri
param.comment: the request URI

param.name: response
param.comment: the authentication response hash

return.comment: the user's primary key if authentication is succesful; 0 otherwise

method.name: authenticateForJAAS
method.comment: Attempts to authenticate the user using JAAS credentials, without using the AuthPipeline.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user

param.name: encPassword
param.comment: the encrypted password

return.comment: true if authentication is successful; false otherwise

method.name: getCompanyUsers
method.comment:
Returns a range of all the users belonging to the company.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the company

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of users

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of users (not inclusive)

return.comment: the range of users belonging to the company

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the users who match the keywords and status, without using the indexer. It is preferable to use the indexed version {@link #search(long, String, int, LinkedHashMap, int, int, Sort)} instead of this method wherever possible for performance reasons.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the user's company

param.name: keywords
param.comment: the keywords (space separated), which may occur in the user's first name, middle name, last name, screen name, or email address

param.name: status
param.comment: the workflow status

param.name: params
param.comment: the finder parameters (optionally null). For more information see {@link com.liferay.portal.service.persistence.UserFinder}.

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of users

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of users (not inclusive)

param.name: obc
param.comment: the comparator to order the users by (optionally null)

return.comment: the matching users

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the users who match the keywords and status, using the indexer. It is preferable to use this method instead of the non-indexed version whenever possible for performance reasons.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the user's company

param.name: keywords
param.comment: the keywords (space separated), which may occur in the user's first name, middle name, last name, screen name, or email address

param.name: status
param.comment: the workflow status

param.name: params
param.comment: the indexer parameters (optionally null). For more information see {@link com.liferay.portlet.usersadmin.util.UserIndexer}.

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of users

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of users (not inclusive)

param.name: sort
param.comment: the field and direction to sort by (optionally null)

return.comment: the matching users

method.name: search
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the users with the status, and whose first name, middle name, last name, screen name, and email address match the keywords specified for them, without using the indexer. It is preferable to use the indexed version {@link #search(long, String, String, String, String, String, int, LinkedHashMap, boolean, int, int, Sort)} instead of this method wherever possible for performance reasons.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the user's company

param.name: firstName
param.comment: the first name keywords (space separated)

param.name: middleName
param.comment: the middle name keywords

param.name: lastName
param.comment: the last name keywords

param.name: screenName
param.comment: the screen name keywords

param.name: emailAddress
param.comment: the email address keywords

param.name: status
param.comment: the workflow status

param.name: params
param.comment: the finder parameters (optionally null). For more information see {@link com.liferay.portal.service.persistence.UserFinder}.

param.name: andSearch
param.comment: whether every field must match its keywords, or just one field. For example, "users with the first name 'bob' and last name 'smith'" vs "users with the first name 'bob' or the last name 'smith'".

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of users

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of users (not inclusive)

param.name: obc
param.comment: the comparator to order the users by (optionally null)

return.comment: the matching users

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

method.name: sendPassword

param.comment: the email subject. If null, the subject specified in portal.properties will be used.

method.name: authenticate
method.comment:
Attempts to authenticate the user by their login and password, while using the AuthPipeline.

Authentication type specifies what login contains.The valid values are:

  • CompanyConstants.AUTH_TYPE_EA - login is the user's email address
  • CompanyConstants.AUTH_TYPE_SN - login is the user's screen name
  • CompanyConstants.AUTH_TYPE_ID - login is the user's primary key

param.name: companyId
param.comment: the primary key of the user's company

param.name: login
param.comment: either the user's email address, screen name, or primary key depending on the value of authType

param.name: password
param.comment: the user's password

param.name: authType
param.comment: the type of authentication to perform

param.name: headerMap
param.comment: the header map from the authentication request

param.name: parameterMap
param.comment: the parameter map from the authentication request

param.name: resultsMap
param.comment: the map of authentication results (may be nil). After a succesful authentication the user's primary key will be placed under the key userId.

return.comment: the authentication status. This can be {@link com.liferay.portal.security.auth.Authenticator#FAILURE} indicating that the user's credentials are invalid, {@link com.liferay.portal.security.auth.Authenticator#SUCCESS} indicating a successful login, or {@link com.liferay.portal.security.auth.Authenticator#DNE} indicating that a user with that login does not exist.

method.name: addUser
method.comment:
Adds a user.

This method handles the creation and bookkeeping of the user including its resources, metadata, and internal data structures. It is not necessary to make subsequent calls to any methods to setup default groups, resources, etc.

param.comment: the user's last name

param.comment: the user's name prefix ID

param.comment: the user's name suffix ID

param.name: male
param.comment: whether the user is male

param.comment: the user's birthday month (0-based, meaning 0 for January)

param.comment: the user's birthday day

param.comment: the user's birthday year

param.comment: the user's job title

param.comment: the primary keys of the user's groups

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the user's service context (optionally null). Can set the universally unique identifier (with the uuid attribute), asset category IDs, asset tag names, and expando bridge attributes for the user.

return.comment: the new user

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the user's information was invalid, if the creator did not have permission to add users, if the email address was reserved, or some other portal exception occurred

javadoc.name: AssetLinkLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
This class implements the methods needed to handle AssetLinks, the entity that relates different assets in the portal.
The basic information stored for every link includes both assets entry IDs, the userId, the link type and the link's weight.
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan
Juan Fernndez

method.name: addLink
method.comment: Adds a new asset link.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the link's creator

param.name: entryId1
param.comment: the primary key of the first asset entry

param.name: entryId2
param.comment: the primary key of the second asset entry

param.name: type
param.comment: the link type. Acceptable values include {@link com.liferay.portlet.asset.model.AssetLinkConstants#TYPE_RELATED} which is a bidirectional relationship and {@link com.liferay.portlet.asset.model.AssetLinkConstants#TYPE_CHILD} which is a unidirectional relationship. For more information see {@link com.liferay.portlet.asset.model.AssetLinkConstants}

param.name: weight
param.comment: the weight of the relationship, allowing precedence ordering of links

return.comment: the asset link

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the user could not be found

method.name: deleteLink
method.comment: Deletes the asset link.

param.name: link
param.comment: the asset link

method.name: deleteLink
method.comment: Deletes the asset link.

param.name: linkId
param.comment: the primary key of the asset link

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the asset link could not be found

method.name: deleteLinks
method.comment: Deletes all links associated with the asset entry.

param.name: entryId
param.comment: the primary key of the asset entry

method.comment: Delete all links that associate the two asset entries.

param.name: entryId1
param.comment: the primary key of the first asset entry

param.name: entryId2
param.comment: the primary key of the second asset entry

param.name: entryId

return.comment: the asset links whose first entry ID is the given entry ID

method.name: getDirectLinks
method.comment: Returns all the asset links of the given link type whose first entry ID is the given entry ID.

param.name: entryId
param.comment: the primary key of the asset entry

param.name: typeId
param.comment: the link type. Acceptable values include {@link com.liferay.portlet.asset.model.AssetLinkConstants#TYPE_RELATED} which is a bidirectional relationship and {@link com.liferay.portlet.asset.model.AssetLinkConstants#TYPE_CHILD} which is a unidirectional relationship. For more information see {@link com.liferay.portlet.asset.model.AssetLinkConstants}

return.comment: the asset links of the given link type whose first entry ID is the given entry ID

method.name: getLinks
method.comment: Returns all the asset links whose first or second entry ID is the given entry ID.

param.name: entryId
param.comment: the primary key of the asset entry

return.comment: the asset links whose first or second entry ID is the given entry ID

method.name: getLinks
method.comment: Returns all the asset links of the given link type whose first or second entry ID is the given entry ID.

param.name: entryId
param.comment: the primary key of the asset entry

param.name: typeId
param.comment: the link type. Acceptable values include {@link com.liferay.portlet.asset.model.AssetLinkConstants#TYPE_RELATED} which is a bidirectional relationship and {@link com.liferay.portlet.asset.model.AssetLinkConstants#TYPE_CHILD} which is a unidirectional relationship. For more information see {@link com.liferay.portlet.asset.model.AssetLinkConstants}

return.comment: the asset links of the given link type whose first or second entry ID is the given entry ID

method.name: getReverseLinks
method.comment: Returns all the asset links of the given link type whose second entry ID is the given entry ID.

param.name: entryId
param.comment: the primary key of the asset entry

param.name: typeId
param.comment: the link type. Acceptable values include {@link com.liferay.portlet.asset.model.AssetLinkConstants#TYPE_RELATED} which is a bidirectional relationship and {@link com.liferay.portlet.asset.model.AssetLinkConstants#TYPE_CHILD} which is a unidirectional relationship. For more information see {@link com.liferay.portlet.asset.model.AssetLinkConstants}

return.comment: the asset links of the given link type whose second entry ID is the given entry ID

method.name: updateLinks
method.comment:
Updates all links of the asset entry, replacing them with links associating the asset entry with the asset entries of the given link entry IDs.

If no link exists with a given link entry ID, a new link is created associating the current asset entry with the asset entry of that link entry ID. An existing link is deleted if either of its entry IDs is not contained in the given link entry IDs.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user updating the links

param.name: entryId
param.comment: the primary key of the asset entry to be managed

param.name: linkEntryIds
param.comment: the primary keys of the asset entries to be linked with the asset entry to be managed

param.name: typeId
param.comment: the type of the asset links to be created. Acceptable values include {@link com.liferay.portlet.asset.model.AssetLinkConstants#TYPE_RELATED} which is a bidirectional relationship and {@link com.liferay.portlet.asset.model.AssetLinkConstants#TYPE_CHILD} which is a unidirectional relationship. For more information see {@link com.liferay.portlet.asset.model.AssetLinkConstants}

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the user could not be found

method.name: getTagStats
method.comment:
Returns a range of all the asset tag statistics instances associated with the asset entry matching the class name ID.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: classNameId
param.comment: the asset entry's class name ID

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of results

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of results (not inclusive)

return.comment: the range of asset tag statistics associated with the asset entry matching the class name ID

javadoc.name: DLAppLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
The document library local service. All portlets should interact with the document library through this class or through {@link DLAppServiceImpl}, rather than through the individual document library service classes.

This class provides a unified interface to all Liferay and third party repositories. While the method signatures are universal for all repositories. Additional implementation-specific parameters may be specified in the serviceContext.

The repositoryId parameter used by most of the methods is the primary key of the specific repository. If the repository is a default Liferay repository, the repositoryId is the groupId or scopeGroupId. Otherwise, the repositoryId will correspond to values obtained from {@link com.liferay.portal.service.RepositoryLocalServiceUtil}.
javadoc.author: Alexander Chow
Mika Koivisto

method.name: addFileEntry
method.comment:
Adds a file entry and associated metadata based on a byte array.

This method takes two file names, the sourceFileName and the title. The sourceFileName corresponds to the name of the actual file being uploaded. The title corresponds to a name the client wishes to assign this file after it has been uploaded to the portal. If it is null, the sourceFileName will be used.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the file entry's creator/owner

param.name: repositoryId
param.comment: the primary key of the file entry's repository

param.name: folderId
param.comment: the primary key of the file entry's parent folder

param.name: sourceFileName
param.comment: the original file's name

param.name: mimeType
param.comment: the file's MIME type

param.name: title
param.comment: the name to be assigned to the file (optionally null )

param.name: description
param.comment: the file's description

param.name: changeLog
param.comment: the file's version change log

param.name: bytes
param.comment: the file's data (optionally null)

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment:
the service context to be applied. Can set the asset category IDs, asset tag names, and expando bridge attributes for the file entry. In a Liferay repository, it may include:
  • fileEntryTypeId - ID for a custom file entry type
  • fieldsMap - mapping for fields associated with a custom file entry type

return.comment: the file entry

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the parent folder could not be found or if the file entry's information was invalid

method.comment:
Updates a file entry and associated metadata based on an {@link java.io. InputStream} object. If the file data is null, then only the associated metadata (i.e., title, description, and parameters in the serviceContext) will be updated.

This method takes two file names, the sourceFileName and the title. The sourceFileName corresponds to the name of the actual file being uploaded. The title corresponds to a name the client wishes to assign this file after it has been uploaded to the portal.

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user

param.name: fileEntryId
param.comment: the primary key of the file entry

param.name: sourceFileName
param.comment: the original file's name (optionally null)

param.name: mimeType
param.comment: the file's MIME type (optionally null)

param.name: title
param.comment: the new name to be assigned to the file (optionally null)

param.name: description
param.comment: the file's new description

param.name: changeLog
param.comment: the file's version change log (optionally null)

param.name: majorVersion
param.comment: whether the new file version is a major version

param.name: is
param.comment: the file's data (optionally null)

param.name: size
param.comment: the file's size (optionally 0)

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment:
the service context to be applied. Can set the asset category IDs, asset tag names, and expando bridge attributes for the file entry. In a Liferay repository, it may include:
  • fileEntryTypeId - ID for a custom file entry type
  • fieldsMap - mapping for fields associated with a custom file entry type

return.comment: the file entry

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the file entry could not be found

method.name: updateFileShortcuts
method.comment: Updates all file shortcuts to the existing file entry to the new file entry. This method is only supported by the Liferay repository.

method.name: updateFolder
method.comment: Updates the folder.

param.name: folderId
param.comment: the primary key of the folder

param.name: parentFolderId
param.comment: the primary key of the folder's new parent folder

param.name: name
param.comment: the folder's new name

param.name: description
param.comment: the folder's new description

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment:
the service context to be applied. In a Liferay repository, it may include:
  • defaultFileEntryTypeId - the file entry type to default all Liferay file entries to
  • dlFileEntryTypesSearchContainerPrimaryKeys - a comma-delimited list of file entry type primary keys allowed in the given folder and all descendants
  • overrideFileEntryTypes - boolean specifying whether to override ancestral folder's restriction of file entry types allowed
  • workflowDefinitionXYZ - the workflow definition name specified per file entry type. The parameter name must be the string workflowDefinition appended by the fileEntryTypeId (optionally 0).

return.comment: the folder

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the current or new parent folder could not be found, or if the new parent folder's information was invalid

javadoc.name: DLAppServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
The document library remote service. All portlets should interact with the document library through this class or through {@link DLAppLocalServiceImpl}, rather than through the individual document library service classes.

This class provides a unified interface to all Liferay and third party repositories. While the method signatures are universal for all repositories. Additional implementation-specific parameters may be specified in the serviceContext.

The repositoryId parameter used by most of the methods is the primary key of the specific repository. If the repository is a default Liferay repository, the repositoryId is the groupId or scopeGroupId. Otherwise, the repositoryId will correspond to values obtained from {@link com.liferay.portal.service.RepositoryServiceUtil}.
javadoc.author: Alexander Chow
Mika Koivisto
Shuyang Zhou

method.name: addFileEntry
method.comment:
Adds a file entry and associated metadata. It is created based on a byte array.

This method takes two file names, the sourceFileName and the title. The sourceFileName corresponds to the name of the actual file being uploaded. The title corresponds to a name the client wishes to assign this file after it has been uploaded to the portal. If it is null, the sourceFileName will be used.

param.name: repositoryId
param.comment: the primary key of the repository

param.name: folderId
param.comment: the primary key of the file entry's parent folder

param.name: sourceFileName
param.comment: the original file's name

param.name: mimeType
param.comment: the file's MIME type

param.name: title
param.comment: the name to be assigned to the file (optionally null )

param.name: description
param.comment: the file's description

param.name: changeLog
param.comment: the file's version change log

param.name: bytes
param.comment: the file's data (optionally null)

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment:
the service context to be applied. Can set the asset category IDs, asset tag names, and expando bridge attributes for the file entry. In a Liferay repository, it may include:
  • fileEntryTypeId - ID for a custom file entry type
  • fieldsMap - mapping for fields associated with a custom file entry type

return.comment: the file entry

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the parent folder could not be found or if the file entry's information was invalid

method.name: addTempFileEntry
method.comment:
Adds a temporary file entry.

This allows a client to upload a file into a temporary location and manipulate its metadata prior to making it available for public usage. This is different from checking in and checking out a file entry.

param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: folderId
param.comment: the primary key of the folder where the file entry will eventually reside

param.name: fileName
param.comment: the file's original name

param.name: tempFolderName
param.comment: the temporary folder's name

param.name: file
param.comment: Name the file's original name

return.comment: the file's name

throws.name: IOException
throws.comment: if a problem occurred in the access or storage of the file

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the file name was invalid

method.name: cancelCheckOut
method.comment:
Cancels the check out of the file entry. If a user has not checked out the specified file entry, invoking this method will result in no changes.

When a file entry is checked out, a PWC (private working copy) is created and the original file entry is locked. A client can make as many changes to the PWC as he desires without those changes being visible to other users. If the user is satisfied with the changes, he may elect to check in his changes, resulting in a new file version based on the PWC; the PWC will be removed and the file entry will be unlocked. If the user is not satisfied with the changes, he may elect to cancel his check out; this results in the deletion of the PWC and unlocking of the file entry.

param.name: fileEntryId
param.comment: the primary key of the file entry to cancel the checkout

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the file entry could not be found

method.name: checkInFileEntry
method.comment:
Checks in the file entry. If a user has not checked out the specified file entry, invoking this method will result in no changes.

When a file entry is checked out, a PWC (private working copy) is created and the original file entry is locked. A client can make as many changes to the PWC as he desires without those changes being visible to other users. If the user is satisfied with the changes, he may elect to check in his changes, resulting in a new file version based on the PWC; the PWC will be removed and the file entry will be unlocked. If the user is not satisfied with the changes, he may elect to cancel his check out; this results in the deletion of the PWC and unlocking of the file entry.

param.name: fileEntryId
param.comment: the primary key of the file entry to check in

param.name: majorVersion
param.comment: whether the new file version is a major version

param.name: changeLog
param.comment: the file's version change log

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the file entry could not be found

method.name: checkInFileEntry
method.comment:
Checks in the file entry using the lock's UUID. If a user has not checked out the specified file entry, invoking this method will result in no changes. This method is primarily used by WebDAV.

When a file entry is checked out, a PWC (private working copy) is created and the original file entry is locked. A client can make as many changes to the PWC as he desires without those changes being visible to other users. If the user is satisfied with the changes, he may elect to check in his changes, resulting in a new file version based on the PWC; the PWC will be removed and the file entry will be unlocked. If the user is not satisfied with the changes, he may elect to cancel his check out; this results in the deletion of the PWC and unlocking of the file entry.

param.name: fileEntryId
param.comment: the primary key of the file entry to check in

param.name: lockUuid
param.comment: the lock's universally unique identifier

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the file entry could not be found

method.name: checkOutFileEntry
method.comment:
Check out a file entry.

When a file entry is checked out, a PWC (private working copy) is created and the original file entry is locked. A client can make as many changes to the PWC as he desires without those changes being visible to other users. If the user is satisfied with the changes, he may elect to check in his changes, resulting in a new file version based on the PWC; the PWC will be removed and the file entry will be unlocked. If the user is not satisfied with the changes, he may elect to cancel his check out; this results in the deletion of the PWC and unlocking of the file entry.

param.name: fileEntryId
param.comment: the file entry to check out

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the file entry could not be found

method.name: checkOutFileEntry
method.comment:
Checks out the file entry. This method is primarily used by WebDAV.

When a file entry is checked out, a PWC (private working copy) is created and the original file entry is locked. A client can make as many changes to the PWC as he desires without those changes being visible to other users. If the user is satisfied with the changes, he may elect to check in his changes, resulting in a new file version based on the PWC; the PWC will be removed and the file entry will be unlocked. If the user is not satisfied with the changes, he may elect to cancel his check out; this results in the deletion of the PWC and unlocking of the file entry.

param.name: fileEntryId
param.comment: the file entry to check out

param.name: owner
param.comment: the owner string for the checkout (optionally null)

param.name: expirationTime
param.comment: the time in milliseconds before the lock expires. If the value is 0, the default expiration time will be used from portal.properties>.

param.name: serviceContext
param.comment: the service context to be applied

return.comment: the file entry

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the file entry could not be found

method.name: getFileEntries
method.comment:
Returns a range of all the file entries in the folder.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: repositoryId
param.comment: the primary key of the file entry's repository

param.name: folderId
param.comment: the primary key of the file entry's folder

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of results

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of results (not inclusive)

return.comment: the range of file entries in the folder

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the folder could not be found

method.name: getFileEntries
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the file entries in the folder.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.name: repositoryId
param.comment: the primary key of the file entry's repository

param.name: folderId
param.comment: the primary key of the file entry's folder

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of results

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of results (not inclusive)

param.name: obc
param.comment: the comparator to order the file entries (optionally null)

return.comment: the range of file entries in the folder ordered by comparator obc

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the folder could not be found

method.name: getGroupFileEntries
method.comment:
Returns an ordered range of all the file entries in the group starting at the repository default parent folder that are stored within the Liferay repository. This method is primarily used to search for recently modified file entries. It can be limited to the file entries modified by a given user.

Useful when paginating results. Returns a maximum of end - start instances. start and end are not primary keys, they are indexes in the result set. Thus, 0 refers to the first result in the set. Setting both start and end to {@link com.liferay.portal.kernel.dao.orm.QueryUtil#ALL_POS} will return the full result set.

param.comment: the primary key of the group

param.name: userId
param.comment: the primary key of the user who created the file (optionally 0)

param.name: start
param.comment: the lower bound of the range of results

param.name: end
param.comment: the upper bound of the range of results (not inclusive)

return.comment: the range of matching file entries ordered by date modified

throws.name: PortalException
throws.comment: if the group could not be found

method.name: updateFileEntry
method.comment:
Updates a file entry and associated metadata based on a byte array object. If the file data is null, then only the associated metadata (i.e., title, description, and parameters in the serviceContext) will be updated.

This method takes two file names, the sourceFileName and the title. The sourceFileName corresponds to the name of the actual file being uploaded. The title corresponds to a name the client wishes to assign this file after it has been uploaded to the portal.

param.name: fileEntryId
param.comment: the primary key of the file entry

param.name: sourceFileName
param.comment: the original file's name (optionally null)

param.name: mimeType
param.comment: the file's MIME type (optionally null)

param.name: title
param.comment: the new name to be assigned to the file (optionally null)

param.name: description
param.comment: the file's new description

param.name: changeLog
param.comment: the file's version change log (optionally null)

param.name: majorVersion

This method takes two file names, the sourceFileName and the title. The sourceFileName corresponds to the name of the actual file being uploaded. The title corresponds to a name the client wishes to assign this file after it has been uploaded to the portal.

javadoc.name: DLFileEntryLocalServiceImpl
javadoc.comment:
The document library file entry local service.

Due to legacy code, the names of some file entry properties are not intuitive. Each file entry has both a name and title. The name is a unique identifier for a given file and is generally numeric, whereas the title is the actual name specified by the user (such as "Budget.xls").
javadoc.author: Brian Wing Shun Chan
Harry Mark
Alexander Chow
Manuel de la Pea
